question: What is the minimum recommended length for a strong password?
options: ["8 characters", "10 characters", "12 characters", "16 characters"]

question: Which of the following is the most secure way to store passwords?
options: ["Write them down on paper", "Use a password manager", "Save them in browser", "Use the same password everywhere"]

question: What should you do if you suspect your password has been compromised?
options: ["Wait and see", "Change it immediately", "Use it for one more week", "Ask IT after the weekend"]

question: Which character types should be included in a strong password?
options: ["Only letters", "Letters and numbers", "Letters, numbers, and symbols", "Only symbols"]

question: How often should you change your passwords?
options: ["Never", "When required or compromised", "Every day", "Every month"]

question: What is the most important security practice for mobile devices?
options: ["Never use them for work", "Enable automatic screen lock", "Only use WiFi", "Turn off all notifications"]

question: Which of the following is a safe practice when using public WiFi?
options: ["Connect to any available network", "Use a VPN", "Disable firewall", "Share your connection"]

question: What should you do before disposing of an old device?
options: ["Sell it immediately", "Wipe all data completely", "Remove the battery", "Just delete files"]

question: How often should you update your device software?
options: ["Never", "When prompted or regularly", "Once a year", "Only when it breaks"]

question: What is the best practice for device physical security?
options: ["Leave it unlocked for convenience", "Always lock and secure when not in use", "Only lock at night", "Share access with colleagues"]

question: Which type of charging cable should you avoid in public places?
options: ["USB-C cables", "Unknown or untrusted cables", "Lightning cables", "Wireless chargers"]

question: What is the most common way phishing attacks are delivered?
options: ["Phone calls", "Email messages", "Text messages", "Social media posts"]

question: Which of the following is a red flag in an email that might indicate phishing?
options: ["Proper grammar", "Urgent action required", "Company logo", "Professional formatting"]

question: What should you do if you receive a suspicious email?
options: ["Click links to verify", "Forward to colleagues", "Report to IT security", "Delete immediately without reporting"]

question: How can you verify if an email is legitimate?
options: ["Check sender address carefully", "Click all links", "Download attachments", "Reply immediately"]

question: What is spear phishing?
options: ["Mass email to everyone", "Targeted attack on specific individuals", "Fishing for compliments", "Spam filtering technique"]

question: Which URL is most likely to be malicious?
options: ["https://company.com/login", "https://c0mpany.com/login", "https://www.company.com", "https://secure.company.com"]

question: What is the best practice when clicking email links?
options: ["Always click immediately", "Hover to preview destination", "Copy and paste into browser", "Never click any links"]

question: What is the most effective way to protect against malware?
options: ["Disable antivirus", "Keep software updated and use antivirus", "Open all email attachments", "Download from any website"]

question: What should you do if you suspect your computer has malware?
options: ["Continue working normally", "Disconnect from network and report to IT", "Try to fix it yourself", "Restart the computer"]

question: Which of the following is a common sign of ransomware infection?
options: ["Faster computer performance", "Files become encrypted or inaccessible", "More available storage space", "Improved internet speed"]

question: What is the best practice for email attachments?
options: ["Open all attachments immediately", "Only open expected attachments from trusted sources", "Never open any attachments", "Forward all attachments to colleagues"]

question: How often should you backup your important data?
options: ["Never", "Once a year", "Regularly and test restoration", "Only when reminded"]

question: What is a common delivery method for ransomware?
options: ["Software updates", "Malicious email attachments", "Legitimate websites", "Antivirus software"]

question: Which type of software should you avoid downloading?
options: ["Antivirus software", "Cracked or pirated software", "Operating system updates", "Legitimate business applications"]

question: What is the first step if you receive a ransomware demand?
options: ["Pay immediately", "Negotiate the price", "Report to IT and law enforcement", "Try to decrypt files yourself"]

question: What is the highest level of data classification typically used in organizations?
options: ["Public", "Internal", "Confidential", "Top Secret"]

question: Which regulation primarily governs data privacy in the European Union?
options: ["CCPA", "GDPR", "HIPAA", "SOX"]

question: How should confidential data be transmitted?
options: ["Plain email", "Encrypted channels", "Text messages", "Social media"]

question: What is the principle of data minimization?
options: ["Collect as much data as possible", "Only collect data necessary for the purpose", "Share data with everyone", "Store data indefinitely"]

question: What should you do if you accidentally send confidential data to the wrong recipient?
options: ["Do nothing", "Immediately notify security team", "Ask recipient to delete", "Send more data to confuse them"]

question: Which of the following is considered Personal Identifiable Information (PII)?
options: ["Company stock price", "Social security number", "Public company address", "Product catalog"]

question: How long should personal data be retained?
options: ["Forever", "Only as long as necessary for the purpose", "Exactly 5 years", "Until the company closes"]

question: What is the right to erasure in GDPR also known as?
options: ["Right to data portability", "Right to be forgotten", "Right to rectification", "Right to object"]

question: Which practice helps ensure data privacy compliance?
options: ["Sharing data freely", "Regular privacy impact assessments", "Ignoring data requests", "Storing data in multiple locations"]

question: What is the first step when you discover a security incident?
options: ["Fix it yourself", "Ignore it", "Immediately report to security team", "Wait until tomorrow"]

question: Which of the following is considered a security incident?
options: ["Slow internet connection", "Unauthorized access to systems", "Scheduled maintenance", "Software update"]

question: What information should be included in an incident report?
options: ["Only the time it occurred", "What happened, when, and who was affected", "Just your name", "Nothing specific"]

question: How should you preserve evidence during a security incident?
options: ["Delete everything", "Take screenshots and avoid changing anything", "Try to fix the problem", "Share it on social media"]

question: What is the purpose of an incident response plan?
options: ["To avoid all incidents", "To provide structured approach to handling incidents", "To blame individuals", "To hide incidents from management"]

question: Who should be notified about a security incident?
options: ["Only yourself", "IT security team and management", "All employees", "External customers first"]

question: What is the recovery phase of incident response?
options: ["Preventing future incidents", "Restoring systems to normal operation", "Documenting the incident", "Identifying the threat"]

question: How soon should you report a suspected security incident?
options: ["Within 24 hours", "Immediately", "Next week", "Only if it gets worse"]

question: What should you do if you are unsure whether something is a security incident?
options: ["Do nothing", "Report it anyway", "Ask a colleague to decide", "Wait for more evidence"]

question: Which of the following helps prevent security incidents?
options: ["Ignoring security policies", "Regular security training and awareness", "Disabling security tools", "Sharing passwords"]
